alluxio.master

Class AbstractMaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • alluxio.master.AbstractMaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JournalCheckpointStreamable, Master
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockMaster, FileSystemMaster, LineageMaster

    @NotThreadSafe
public abstract class AbstractMaster
extends Object
implements Master
    This is the base class for all masters, and contains common functionality. Common functionality mostly consists of journal operations, like initialization, journal tailing when in standby mode, or journal writing when the master is the leader.

      • AbstractMaster

        protected AbstractMaster(Journal journal,
                         Clock clock,
                         ExecutorServiceFactory executorServiceFactory)
        Parameters:
        journal - the journal to use for tracking master operations
        clock - the Clock to use for determining the time
        executorServiceFactory - a factory for creating the executor service to use for running maintenance threads

    • Method Detail

      • processJournalCheckpoint

        public void processJournalCheckpoint(JournalInputStream inputStream)
                              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Master
        Processes the journal checkpoint file and applies the entries to the master.
        Specified by:
        processJournalCheckpoint in interface Master
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the input stream for the journal checkpoint file
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

      • start

        public void start(boolean isLeader)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Master
        Starts the master, as the leader master or the standby master. Here, the master should initialize state and possibly start threads required for operation. If isLeader is true, the master should also initialize the journal and write the checkpoint file.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Master
        Parameters:
        isLeader - if true, the master should behave as the leader master in the system. If false, the master should act as a standby master.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Master
        Stops the master. Here, anything created or started in Master.start(boolean) should be cleaned up and shutdown.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Master
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

      • upgradeToReadWriteJournal

        public void upgradeToReadWriteJournal(ReadWriteJournal journal)
        Description copied from interface: Master
        Provides the master with a ReadWriteJournal capable of writing, in preparation to starting as the leader. This enables transitioning from standby master to leader master without having to construct a new master object.
        Specified by:
        upgradeToReadWriteJournal in interface Master
        Parameters:
        journal - the ReadWriteJournal capable of writing

      • writeJournalEntry

        protected void writeJournalEntry(Journal.JournalEntry entry)
        Writes a Journal.JournalEntry to the journal. Does NOT flush the journal.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Journal.JournalEntry to write to the journal

      • flushJournal

        protected void flushJournal()
        Flushes the journal.

      • appendJournalEntry

        protected long appendJournalEntry(Journal.JournalEntry entry)

      • waitForJournalFlush

        protected void waitForJournalFlush(long counter)
        Waits for the flush counter to be flushed to the journal. If the counter is AsyncJournalWriter.INVALID_FLUSH_COUNTER, this is a noop.
        Parameters:
        counter - the flush counter

      • getExecutorService

        protected ExecutorService getExecutorService()
        Returns:
        the ExecutorService for this master
